episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and fascinating topics, including plans for a giant robot Michael Jackson, historical myths about hedgehogs, the eccentric habits of philosopher Herbert Spencer, and the scientific impracticalities of Spider-Man's wall-climbing abilities.

facts.fact: In 2005, there were plans to make a 50-foot tall robot Michael Jackson that would roam around the Nevada desert.
In the 16th century, people disliked hedgehogs because it was believed that they sucked cows' udders.
The English philosopher Herbert Spencer had an angry suit specially made, which he wore only when he was feeling irritable.
In order for Spider-Man to climb buildings, he would need size 89 feet.
